item.title: The Self
item.description: One of the most remarkable qualities of human kind is our ability to navigate our immensely complex social environments. Our brain has evolved the capacity to build a rich model of the self which in turn has become an essential tool that we use to understand our social situations and our place in society. (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.

Biography Taylor Guthrie is a PhD student in the Computational Social Neuroscience Lab at the University of Oregon. He wishes to understand how the concept of self is built and how it is represented and encoded in the distributed networks of the brain. Additionally he is investigating how these distributed patterns of self change from individual to individual and how they differ across cultures. Through the use of various multimodal imaging methods and multivariate machine learning techniques, he hopes to probe the depths of these various processes and uncover the structure that underlies their ultimate purpose and function.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am a teachers assistant for the following courses at University of Oregon: PSY 201: Mind and Brain PSY 302: Statistical Methods in Psychology CHEM 229: General Chemistry Laboratory
